qas.question: How many states are in Germany?
What is the German terms for states?
Which cities are called Stadtstaaten, other than Bremen?
The Free Hanseatic City of Bremen includes which cities?
How many federal states are in Stadtstaaten?
What are Bremen and Bremerhaven frequently called?

plausible_answers.text: the Free Hanseatic City of Bremen

qas.question: What city state contains the cities of Berlin and Hamberg?

plausible_answers.text: an earlier collection of several states

qas.question: What were the cities of Berlin and Hamberg formed from?
What kind of republic is Switzerland?
What is one of the sixteen federal states of Germany?
What is one of Germany's constituent states?
What is the name of a state in Germany that is not a city-state?
Flachenlander is one of how many states in Germany?

context: Germany is a <b10_0>federal republic<b10_0/> consisting of <a0_0><b5_0>sixteen<b5_0/><a0_0/> federal states (German: <a1_0><b11_0>Bundesland<b11_0/>, or Land<a1_0/>).[a] Since today's Germany was formed from <b9_0>an earlier collection of several states<b9_0/>, it has a federal constitution, and the constituent states retain <b7_0>a measure of sovereignty<b7_0/>. With an emphasis on geographical conditions, <a2_0><b13_0>Berlin<b13_0/> and <b12_0>Hamburg<b12_0/><a2_0/> are frequently called <b6_0>Stadtstaaten (city-states)<b6_0/>, as is <b8_0>the Free Hanseatic City of Bremen<b8_0/>, which in fact includes the cities of <a4_0>Bremen and Bremerhaven<a4_0/>. The remaining <a3_0><b14_0>13<a3_0/> states<b14_0/> are called Flächenländer (literally: area states).
